title: WaTech records index

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: WaTech records index
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The current index of records maintained by Washington Technology Solutions pursuant to RCW 42.56.070(5).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I would prefer the request filled electronically if possible.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Wallace

title: USTDA: ChatGPT Chat Histories and Guidance

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: USTDA: ChatGPT Chat Histories and Guidance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any USTDA produced policies, memos, emails, PowerPoint presentations or alerts regarding employee use of ChatGPT.
2. Any USTDA produced policies, memos, emails, or alerts regarding how ChatGPT either impacts or might impact USTDA's mission.
3. Chat histories of all ChatGPT sessions conducted on USTDA controlled devices between November 30th, 2022 and October 31st, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Skagit County Sheriff: 1989 Bow, Washington John Doe

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Skagit County Sheriff: 1989 Bow, Washington John Doe
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All Skagit County Sheriff Department documents, dispatch logs, incident reports, follow-up reports, copies of medical examiner's reports or photographs, or anything that could be construed as a "case file" or "case documents" or "relevant documents" related to the discovery of the skeletal remains of an unidentified male decedent who was discovered in Bow, Washington on February 20th of 1989. Please include a search for any electronic communication (to or from) either NCIC or WACIC related to these unidentified remains.

This case has been repeatedly covered in the news media, each time with requests to spread information about the case to the public in order to help generate leads which might to assist in identification: https://www.goskagit.com/news/sheriff-s-office-renews-effort-to-identify-john-doe/article_729c57eb-89e2-50bd-a38f-8db7d70eb126.html

The Skagit County Sheriff Agency Case Number is 89-01753. 

If the Skagit County Sheriff's Department cannot fulfill certain parts of this request or if certain portions (for example, photographs) must be redacted, please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

As a hobby I research unidentified decedent cases and will attempt to use information released in an attempt to generate leads. Thank you for the Skagit County Sheriff Department's commitment to transparency. I look forward to working with you to resolve this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Jon Cobb Military Service Records

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Jon Cobb Military Service Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the Military Personnel Files (OMPF) for a former service member named Jonathan David Cobb (U.S. Marine Corps who joined in 2004 at 17, serving two tours ), whose year of birth is 1987.

The public interest in Jon Cobb, who is running for the school board for Temecula Valley Unified School District in California, should favor disclosing many of these records, particularly any disciplinary records, should those records exist.

Please review and release any segregable information, even if certain documents or portions of documents are withheld.

PLEASE NOTE: I am not the next of kin of this service member, and thus, I do not know Jon Cobb's Social Security Number. Because of this, I am ONLY requesting records that are releasable under the Freedom of Information Act. Please process my request for this servicemember's OMPF and other records under the relevant provisions of the Freedom of Information Act. I am not seeking any records that would be releasable under the Privacy Act.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Diara

title: Camp Compassion Budget Items

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Camp Compassion Budget Items
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear City Clerk,

I am writing to request access to all records, contracts , receipts , and financial information related to the services provided at the homeless camp located at 1720 Novato Blvd , Lee Gerner Park aka Camp Compassion in Novato , Ca . between January 1st 2020-October 30th 2024

Specifically , I am interested in the following information; 

Service Providers:
A list of all companies or organizations contracted to provide services at Lee Gerner Park encampment aka Camp Compassion.
Copies of all contracts or agreements with these service :providers . 
																	
Services:      
A detailed list of the services provided , including but not limited to :
    *Rat abatement and rodent control
    * Clean ups Crews 
    * Garbage Service 
    * Porta potty / handwashing station rental and maintenance 
    *Security 
     * Electric cost and estimates for repairs   
     * Tree work arborist 
    * Maintenance or repairs 

Costs :    
A breakdown of the costs associated with each service provided including : 
  *Hourly rates or fixed fees 
  * Material Costs 
 *Overhead expenses 
Cost of supplies purchased by the City of Novato , such as tents, tarps, sleeping bags , sleeping matts , Canopies or any other supplies, please include receipts or other documentation supporting these purchases. 


Funding : 
A detailed explanation of how the city obtained the funds to operate the homeless camp at Lee Gerner Park aka Camp Compassion, including: 
     *Grant information
      *Budget allocations

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robbie Powelson

title: City of Novato, Camp Compassion, Homeless Camp Evictions and Policies

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: City of Novato, Camp Compassion, Homeless Camp Evictions and Policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Subject; FOIA Request - Homeless Camp Evictions


	I am writing to request any and all records, policies and procedures related to evictions and applications at the temporary camp located at 1720 Novato Blvd, Novato, Ca in Lee Gerner Park aka Camp Compassion.

 	Specifically , I am interested in the following information: 

Evictions : 
Any and all records or documentation, memos or memorandum of understanding related to evictions of Sheila and Crystal, Bryan Duran and Jess Tassi From the temporary camp at Lee Gerner Park aka Camp Compassion From 2021 thru present 
Any communications with the City of Novato  or its agents or service providers related to Sheila and Crystals eviction from Sanctioned encampment at Lee Garner Park aka Camp Compassion including emails, memos or meeting minutes or memorandum of understanding Novato Police Department or its agents, advise given regarding eviction and allowing violence to continue From January 2024 thru July 2024 . 
All evictions and notices , contracts , and agreements related to the evictions of all camp residents from the Motel /hotel program  at the Days Inn Located at from the City of Novato after the fire from  July 30, 2024 ending Aug 30, 2024. 
Records of any hearings or appeals related to these evictions 
Information regarding the reasons for the evictions, including allegations of violence or not following code of conduct, hoarding or any requests for evictions made to the City of Novato  from the Marin County chapter or The California Homeless Union.
Details about why these individuals were not evicted despite allegations of violence , and misconduct , hate speech and hoarding behavior or at the request of union designee(s)

Applications: 
   Copies of all applications received by the City of Novato from individuals seeking to live at the temporary camp at Lee Garner Park at 1720 Novato Blvd, Novato, Ca aka Camp Compassion.

title: Police data collection (2017-2022)

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Police data collection (2017-2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. the total number of use of force incidents from 2020-2023, separated by year. Please include, as part of this a breakdown, how many use of force incidents were related to law enforcement operations 
2. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by year and type of force, from 2020-2023 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2023, baton incidents in 2023, etc.)
3. the total number of civilian complaints against law enforcement that were reported and the total number sustained from 2020-2023, separated by year.  
4. the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained from 2020-2023, separated by year. 
5. the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained from 2020-2023, separated by year.  
6. the total number of civilian complaints alleging criminal conduct that were reported and the total number sustained from 2020-2023, separated by year. 
7. the total number of officer-involved shootings from 2020-2023, both fatal and non-fatal, separated by year.
8. the total number of people who the sheriff’s department used force against, broken down by race/ethnicity
9. Complaints filed by one officer towards another officer

When available, please provide the data in separate CSV files by year.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alessandro Guzman

title: FBI: Thomas Carlyle Rabbitt, Jr.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI: Thomas Carlyle Rabbitt, Jr.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any bureau records related to Thomas Carlyle Rabbittt, Jr., also known as Thomas Rabbitt and Tom Rabbitt. Rabbit was born in May 15th of 1905 in the state of Montana and died in March 1961 in Seattle, Washington. Rabbitt was publicly labeled as a communist during the Canwell Committee hearings in Washington State. In the early 1950s Rabbitt was head of the Washington State Progressive Party. 

Please note: A previous FOIA release (FOIA Request: 1215960-000, SUBJECT: ROSELLINI, ALBERT DEAN) prominently mentions that as of 1952 Rabbitt was a, "Security Index subject at the Seattle office" of the FBI. As a "Security Index subject" the bureau presumably amassed a significant amount of material on Rabbitt. 

Please include searches for correspondence either to or from Director Hoover or Clyde Tolson regarding Rabbitt. Please also include a search for correspondence either to or from Mark Felt regarding Rabbit. Felt was assigned to the Seattle office in the early 1950s and could have generated material on Rabbitt during the course of his duties. 

This request is for any and all records about Thomas "Tom" Carlyle Rabbitt from any and all FBI offices, including HQ, field offices, legal attaches, and facilities that maintain records under the FBI’s control. Please conduct a search for any records on Rabbit held by the Seattle or Chicago field offices. Rabbit lived in, and repeatedly visited, the city of Chicago.

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, etc. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency. Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials related to Rabbitt. According to a blog post I just read, it is important that I state the following: "As you know, your agency is required to search the records stored at NARA’s Washington Records Center in Suitland, MD, but still technically under your agency’s control. For more information see 36 CFR 1250.8" Please also conduct a physical search of records at NARA's Washington Records Center in Suitland, for any records or documents related to Thomas Carlyle Rabbitt. 

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, etc. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency. Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials related to Thomas Rabbitt.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to Washington Headquarters Services Field activity for all White House Office of Public Engagement collaborations for 2003
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all the films that the White House Office of Public Engagement has participated in the production of, in any capacity whatsoever, for the year 2023. title: Freedom of Information Act Request: Al French Service Record

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Freedom of Information Act Request: Al French Service Record
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the Military Personnel Files (OMPF) for a former service member named Alfred G French (U.S. Marine Corps from 1969 to 1972), whose DOB is April 1951.

The public interest in Al French, who is running for Spokane County Commissioner in Washington State, should favor disclosing many of these records, particularly any disciplinary records, should those records exist.

Please review and release any segregable information, even if certain documents or portions of documents are withheld.

PLEASE NOTE: I am not the next of kin of this service member, and thus, I do not know Al French's Social Security Number. Because of this, I am ONLY requesting records that are releasable under the Freedom of Information Act. Please process my request for this servicemember's OMPF and other records under the relevant provisions of the Freedom of Information Act. I am not seeking any records that would be releasable under the Privacy Act.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Diara

communications.communication:

Thank you for contacting the National Archives at St. Louis.

If you are seeking Official Military Personnel Files for military service 
members you will need to fill out a Standard Form 180 and mail it to 
address 14 on page 3 of the request form. I have attached that form to this 
email.

You can also use the eVetRecs request tool to request your OMPF.

https://vetrecs.archives.gov/VeteranRequest/home.html

Thank you,

David R. Hardin
Supervisory Archivist- Reference Chief
National Archives at St. Louis

Your request was received in this office on 10/30/2024 and given the reference number S020910-103024 for tracking purposes. Spokane County Sheriff provides access to public records in compliance with applicable laws and statutes of the State of Washington. In accordance with the public records law, the Sheriff's office has five business days to respond to a request for public records. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Rose Terse

Not all public documents are available in electronic format. If the document(s) requested are not available electronically, we will make them available for inspection or by paper copy in accordance with the Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW, does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
 
Please be advised that Spokane Regional Emergency Communications ("SREC") is the custodian of 911 and Crime Check audio recordings as well as audio recordings of dispatch and radio traffic. If you are attempting to obtain audio recordings of 911/Crime Check calls and/or radio traffic, you need to submit a separate request to SREC directly. You can submit a records request to SREC via their website, https://www.srec911.com. 
Spokane County

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions.

title: Sustainable Community Schools, 5 vendors

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Sustainable Community Schools, 5 vendors
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Provide records sufficient to show the following:

1) A list of schools that America Scores Chicago, Brighton Park Neighborhood Council, SGA Youth and Family Services, Kenwood Oakland Community Organization, and Southwest Organizing Project have served in school years 2023-2024 and 2024-2025 to date. 

2) Copies of all invoices from America Scores Chicago, Brighton Park Neighborhood Council, SGA Youth and Family Services, Kenwood Oakland Community Organization, and Southwest Organizing Project have served in school years 2023-2024 and 2024-2025 to date for each school which they serve.

3) Copies of records of payments by CPS/Chicago Board of Education to America Scores Chicago, Brighton Park Neighborhood Council, SGA Youth and Family Services, Kenwood Oakland Community Organization, and Southwest Organizing Project for the above noted time frames. I want the actual bills as well as proof of payment by the district or school, as the case may be.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #25-F-0550
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern,

I am writing to appeal the rejection of FOIA request #25-F-0550, in which I requested all communications with documentary filmmaker Jesse Moss. According to the Final Response, my request was rejected because it failed to request "specific records." This is not correct. I gave specific examples of the sort of records that would be responsive to my request,  namely "emails, correspondence, memos, and transcriptions of telephone calls." I also mentioned a specific office where such records might be located.

I therefore appeal the rejection and reiterate my request. 

Respectfully,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: A16832-24 Kent Hoover - PRR 10/30/2024 Acknowledgement of Records Request
communications.communication:
Hello,

We are in receipt of your request as referenced above.  Please be advised that Shelby County Government has established a policy for costs and fees associated with responding to public records requests.

Pursuant to the Shelby County Government Public Records Policy, we assess copy costs of 0.15 cents per page for black and white copies, 0.50 cents per page for color copies, and $10.00 for electronic media. We also assess labor fees of $15.00 per hour for every hour exceeding the first hour. If it is determined that costs and/or fees apply, we will notify you when it becomes available. In addition, if the costs and/or fees are estimated to exceed $50.00, our policy requires payment in advance. In the event estimated production costs exceed $50.00, we will notify you so that you can make payment before we complete the request.

Sincerely,
Shelby County Public Records

communications.subject: A16832-24 Kent Hoover - PRR 10/30/2024 - Request for Proof of Tennessee Citizenship
communications.communication:
Hello,

We are in receipt of your request. However, your correspondence does not provide any proof of your Tennessee citizenship.

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, codified by Tenn. Code Ann. § 10-7-101, et seq., Shelby County Government’s records are not open to inspection by individuals who are not Tennessee citizens. See Tenn. Code Ann. § 10-7-503(a)(2)(A)(“[a]ll state, county, and municipal records … shall at all times, during business hours, be open … for inspection by any citizen of Tennessee”); see also Ray v. Stanton, C.A. No. 88-285-II, 1989 WL 14135, *3 (Tenn. Ct. App. Feb. 24, 1989)(finding that the provisions of the Public Records Act are available only for any citizen of the State of Tennessee); and Tenn. Op. Atty. Gen. No. 01-132, 2001 WL 1048622 (Tenn. A.G. August 22, 2001)(persons who are not citizens of Tennessee can be denied access to public records under the Tennessee Public Records Act).

Without providing proof of Tennessee citizenship (i.e., a copy of your TN driver license, etc.), we are unable to process your request.

Failure to provide this information within seven (7) business days will result in the closure of your file.

Sincerely,
Shelby County Public Records

title: Records Regarding Connecticut Medicaid Programs, ABI Waiver, Amendments, and Federal Agency Oversight and Communications with Accenture and Manatt (2012–Present) (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Records Regarding Connecticut Medicaid Programs, ABI Waiver, Amendments, and Federal Agency Oversight and Communications with Accenture and Manatt (2012–Present) (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Subject: FOIA Request for Comprehensive Records Regarding Connecticut Medicaid Programs, ABI Waiver Amendments, and Federal Agency Oversight and Communications with Accenture and Manatt (2012–Present)

To:

Connecticut Agencies:

Department of Social Services (DSS)
Office of Policy and Management (OPM)
Office of the Attorney General
Office of Health Strategy (OHS)
State Comptroller’s Office
Auditors of Public Accounts (APA)

Federal Agencies:

Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS)
U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)
Office of Inspector General, U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (OIG, HHS)
U.S. Government Accountability Office (GAO)
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
Department of Justice (DOJ) – Civil Rights Division
Date: 10.29.2024

From:
David Medeiros
ABI Resources
Email: AabiWR@live.com

Request for Records Under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA)
Dear FOIA Officers and Supervisory Officers,

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act (Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-200 et seq.) and the federal Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I respectfully request access to all records from January 1, 2012, to the present related to communications, funding, agreements, policy analysis, and compliance oversight involving Connecticut’s Medicaid programs, particularly focusing on the Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program. This request pertains to records involving the following entities:

Connecticut Department of Social Services (DSS)
Accenture and Manatt, Phelps & Phillips, LLP (Manatt), in their roles as consultants to DSS

Federal agencies involved in Medicaid program oversight, including CMS, HHS, OIG, GAO, CDC, and DOJ’s Civil Rights Division
This request supports transparency, accountability, and oversight of Medicaid programs affecting vulnerable populations, particularly those involved in the ABI Waiver Program, managed care models, and accessibility initiatives.

Scope and Objectives of the Request
The objective of this request is to capture comprehensive records to allow for independent review, transparency, and the protection of vulnerable Medicaid populations in the following areas:

Medicaid Program Amendments and Policy Modifications
Records of amendments to the ABI Waiver Program and other Medicaid waivers managed by Connecticut DSS in consultation with Accenture and Manatt, as reviewed by federal agencies (CMS, HHS).

Medicaid Landscape Analysis and Managed Care Exploration
Documentation of data analysis, policy exploration, and evaluations related to managed care models, digital health, and accessibility for Medicaid recipients, conducted by Accenture and Manatt with DSS and reviewed by CMS or other federal entities.

Data Collection and Stakeholder Engagement
Information regarding data collection methodologies targeting Medicaid members, providers, and stakeholders, including strategies to ensure accessibility, equity, and compliance with federal and state protections.

Federal Oversight, Accountability, and Compliance
Documentation from federal agencies related to funding compliance, regulatory oversight, or audits, evaluations, or investigations assessing DSS’s Medicaid program management, especially regarding the ABI Waiver and the involvement of Accenture and Manatt.

Detailed Records Requested
Please provide copies of the following documents:

Contracts, Agreements, and Operational Frameworks
Connecticut DSS: Contracts, MOUs, agreements, and scope of work documents between DSS and Accenture or Manatt.
Federal Agencies (CMS, HHS, GAO, OIG): Federal approvals, reviews, or conditions placed on Connecticut’s Medicaid amendments or funding, particularly involving the ABI Waiver and managed care services.

Communications and Procedural Directives
Connecticut DSS: Email and written communications between DSS officials and representatives of Accenture and Manatt, specifically concerning Medicaid program amendments, stakeholder engagement, and managed care exploration.
Federal Agencies: Correspondence with DSS or contractors, as well as procedural directives involving Accenture or Manatt’s contributions to Medicaid policy or program operations.
Metadata and Communication Logs: Metadata (sender, recipient, date, subject) and communication logs documenting DSS, CMS, HHS, or GAO interactions with Accenture or Manatt.

Meetings and Strategy Documentation
Connecticut DSS: Agendas, minutes, attendance records, and presentations from strategic planning sessions involving DSS, Accenture, and Manatt.
Federal Agencies: Records from any forums, workshops, or review meetings with DSS regarding Connecticut’s Medicaid amendments, ABI Waiver program updates, or evaluations of managed care models.

Analysis, Recommendations, and Raw Data

Connecticut DSS and Federal Agencies (CMS, GAO): All data, draft versions, and final recommendations produced by Accenture and Manatt, including raw data, methodology documentation, and preliminary findings related to Medicaid program evaluations.
CDC Data on ABI/TBI: Any ABI or TBI-related data provided to DSS, Accenture, or Manatt, which may impact Medicaid ABI Waiver amendments.

Medicaid Provider and Consumer Access and Contact Records
Connecticut DSS: Documentation on Medicaid provider registry updates, provider affiliations, approval dates, and criteria used to select providers for feedback or analysis.
Federal Oversight: GAO or OIG records on Medicaid provider networks and consumer engagement requirements, particularly in relation to accessibility for individuals with disabilities.

Accessibility and Data Collection Accommodations
Connecticut DSS and Federal Agencies: Documentation of accommodations ensuring accessibility for individuals with disabilities, including language assistance, assistive technology, and accommodations in data collection and stakeholder engagement processes.
FOIA Compliance and Whistleblower Reports

Connecticut DSS and Federal Oversight (OIG, DOJ Civil Rights): Records related to previous FOIA requests, exemptions, information withheld, and any legal citations applied, as well as whistleblower complaints or investigations into DSS, Accenture, or Manatt regarding Medicaid program oversight, ethical conduct, or data manipulation.


Expedited processing is requested based on the following compelling factors:

Significant Public Interest in Government Transparency: Medicaid programs are taxpayer-funded and affect a large segment of the public. Ensuring that DSS’s activities and collaborations with consulting firms like Accenture and Manatt align with federal and state standards is of great public interest. Expedited processing will allow public scrutiny and foster informed dialogue on the management and ethical administration of Medicaid services. The requested information will help assess whether any waste, fraud, or abuse has occurred within DSS’s partnerships. Prompt access to these records is essential to identify any potential misconduct and prevent ongoing misuse of taxpayer dollars, particularly within critical programs affecting vulnerable populations.

Time-Sensitive Advocacy Needs: This information is critical for advocacy efforts that inform stakeholders, ensure consumer protection, and foster transparency. Any delay could impede the ability of stakeholders, including advocacy groups and affected individuals, to respond adequately to Medicaid policy changes.

Justification for Fee Waiver
This information will serve the public interest by supporting oversight, transparency, and protection for Medicaid recipients, particularly Connecticut’s ABI Waiver participants. The release of these records will contribute to the ethical and accountable administration of taxpayer-funded programs. Accordingly, I request a waiver of fees for processing this request.

Delivery and Accessibility Requirements
To accommodate disability-related needs, please provide all records in digital format via email and avoid using external portals. If records cannot be provided within statutory timeframes, or if any information is withheld, please notify me promptly with legal justifications at AabiWR@live.com

Thank you for your attention and assistance in providing these records to facilitate public understanding and oversight of Connecticut Medicaid services.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
ABI Resources

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS

communications.subject: Your Login Information - Centers for Disease Control and Prevention / Agency for Toxic Substances and Disease Registry

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #25-00142-FOIA
communications.communication:
Subject: Appeal and Request for Comprehensive Basic Accommodations on FOIA Request No. 25-00142-FOIA

Dear CDC/ATSDR FOIA Office,

I am writing to appeal the current handling of my FOIA request (Request No. 25-00142-FOIA), initially submitted on October 30, 2024, regarding Connecticut Medicaid programs, ABI waiver amendments, and federal oversight and communications with Accenture and Manatt from 2012 to the present.

Firstly, I request an appeal of the response provided, as it is unclear whether all relevant records were fully reviewed to ensure a complete and exhaustive response. Given the scope and importance of these subjects, a thorough investigation and access to all responsive records are crucial.

In addition, I would like to reiterate the following basic accommodations that I have consistently requested due to my TBI and specific accessibility needs:

Email-Only Communication: All communications regarding this FOIA request should be conducted solely through email. I am unable to communicate effectively by phone, and portals or alternate platforms create significant accessibility barriers.

Full Response Language in Email Body: For my accessibility, please include the full response text within the body of the email, rather than solely as an attachment. Attachments are difficult for me to access and interpret, impacting my ability to engage with the response fully.

Identification of Officers: Please include the full name, title, and direct contact information of the officer managing my request in each communication. This information is critical for accountability and effective communication on my end.

No Use of Portals or External Links: In line with my accessibility needs, please avoid using external links, portals, or any resources that would require navigating away from the email. This ensures I can access the information seamlessly within one location.

Clear and Concise Responses: Due to memory and processing challenges associated with my TBI, I request that all responses be clear, comprehensive, and concise, facilitating my ability to stay focused and process the information effectively.

I request confirmation that these accommodations will be honored in all future communications. Additionally, please confirm receipt of this appeal and provide an update regarding the additional search measures taken to locate all potentially responsive records.

Thank you for your attention to these accommodations and your dedication to ensuring accessibility and completeness in the FOIA process.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
AabiWR@live.com

title: Records Regarding Connecticut Medicaid Programs, ABI Waiver, Amendments, and Federal Agency Oversight and Communications with Accenture and Manatt (2012–Present) (Office of the State Comptroller)

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Records Regarding Connecticut Medicaid Programs, ABI Waiver, Amendments, and Federal Agency Oversight and Communications with Accenture and Manatt (2012–Present) (Office of the State Comptroller)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Subject: FOIA Request for Comprehensive Records Regarding Connecticut Medicaid Programs, ABI Waiver Amendments, and Federal Agency Oversight and Communications with Accenture and Manatt (2012–Present)

To:

Connecticut Agencies:

Department of Social Services (DSS)
Office of Policy and Management (OPM)
Office of the Attorney General
Office of Health Strategy (OHS)
State Comptroller’s Office
Auditors of Public Accounts (APA)

Federal Agencies:

Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS)
U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)
Office of Inspector General, U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (OIG, HHS)
U.S. Government Accountability Office (GAO)
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
Department of Justice (DOJ) – Civil Rights Division
Date: 10.29.2024

From:
David Medeiros
ABI Resources
Email: AabiWR@live.com

Request for Records Under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA)
Dear FOIA Officers and Supervisory Officers,

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act (Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-200 et seq.) and the federal Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I respectfully request access to all records from January 1, 2012, to the present related to communications, funding, agreements, policy analysis, and compliance oversight involving Connecticut’s Medicaid programs, particularly focusing on the Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program. This request pertains to records involving the following entities:

Connecticut Department of Social Services (DSS)
Accenture and Manatt, Phelps & Phillips, LLP (Manatt), in their roles as consultants to DSS

Federal agencies involved in Medicaid program oversight, including CMS, HHS, OIG, GAO, CDC, and DOJ’s Civil Rights Division
This request supports transparency, accountability, and oversight of Medicaid programs affecting vulnerable populations, particularly those involved in the ABI Waiver Program, managed care models, and accessibility initiatives.

Scope and Objectives of the Request
The objective of this request is to capture comprehensive records to allow for independent review, transparency, and the protection of vulnerable Medicaid populations in the following areas:

Medicaid Program Amendments and Policy Modifications
Records of amendments to the ABI Waiver Program and other Medicaid waivers managed by Connecticut DSS in consultation with Accenture and Manatt, as reviewed by federal agencies (CMS, HHS).

Medicaid Landscape Analysis and Managed Care Exploration
Documentation of data analysis, policy exploration, and evaluations related to managed care models, digital health, and accessibility for Medicaid recipients, conducted by Accenture and Manatt with DSS and reviewed by CMS or other federal entities.

Data Collection and Stakeholder Engagement
Information regarding data collection methodologies targeting Medicaid members, providers, and stakeholders, including strategies to ensure accessibility, equity, and compliance with federal and state protections.

Federal Oversight, Accountability, and Compliance
Documentation from federal agencies related to funding compliance, regulatory oversight, or audits, evaluations, or investigations assessing DSS’s Medicaid program management, especially regarding the ABI Waiver and the involvement of Accenture and Manatt.

Detailed Records Requested
Please provide copies of the following documents:

Contracts, Agreements, and Operational Frameworks
Connecticut DSS: Contracts, MOUs, agreements, and scope of work documents between DSS and Accenture or Manatt.
Federal Agencies (CMS, HHS, GAO, OIG): Federal approvals, reviews, or conditions placed on Connecticut’s Medicaid amendments or funding, particularly involving the ABI Waiver and managed care services.

Communications and Procedural Directives
Connecticut DSS: Email and written communications between DSS officials and representatives of Accenture and Manatt, specifically concerning Medicaid program amendments, stakeholder engagement, and managed care exploration.
Federal Agencies: Correspondence with DSS or contractors, as well as procedural directives involving Accenture or Manatt’s contributions to Medicaid policy or program operations.
Metadata and Communication Logs: Metadata (sender, recipient, date, subject) and communication logs documenting DSS, CMS, HHS, or GAO interactions with Accenture or Manatt.

Meetings and Strategy Documentation
Connecticut DSS: Agendas, minutes, attendance records, and presentations from strategic planning sessions involving DSS, Accenture, and Manatt.
Federal Agencies: Records from any forums, workshops, or review meetings with DSS regarding Connecticut’s Medicaid amendments, ABI Waiver program updates, or evaluations of managed care models.

Analysis, Recommendations, and Raw Data

Connecticut DSS and Federal Agencies (CMS, GAO): All data, draft versions, and final recommendations produced by Accenture and Manatt, including raw data, methodology documentation, and preliminary findings related to Medicaid program evaluations.
CDC Data on ABI/TBI: Any ABI or TBI-related data provided to DSS, Accenture, or Manatt, which may impact Medicaid ABI Waiver amendments.

Medicaid Provider and Consumer Access and Contact Records
Connecticut DSS: Documentation on Medicaid provider registry updates, provider affiliations, approval dates, and criteria used to select providers for feedback or analysis.
Federal Oversight: GAO or OIG records on Medicaid provider networks and consumer engagement requirements, particularly in relation to accessibility for individuals with disabilities.

Accessibility and Data Collection Accommodations
Connecticut DSS and Federal Agencies: Documentation of accommodations ensuring accessibility for individuals with disabilities, including language assistance, assistive technology, and accommodations in data collection and stakeholder engagement processes.
FOIA Compliance and Whistleblower Reports

Connecticut DSS and Federal Oversight (OIG, DOJ Civil Rights): Records related to previous FOIA requests, exemptions, information withheld, and any legal citations applied, as well as whistleblower complaints or investigations into DSS, Accenture, or Manatt regarding Medicaid program oversight, ethical conduct, or data manipulation.


Expedited processing is requested based on the following compelling factors:

Significant Public Interest in Government Transparency: Medicaid programs are taxpayer-funded and affect a large segment of the public. Ensuring that DSS’s activities and collaborations with consulting firms like Accenture and Manatt align with federal and state standards is of great public interest. Expedited processing will allow public scrutiny and foster informed dialogue on the management and ethical administration of Medicaid services. The requested information will help assess whether any waste, fraud, or abuse has occurred within DSS’s partnerships. Prompt access to these records is essential to identify any potential misconduct and prevent ongoing misuse of taxpayer dollars, particularly within critical programs affecting vulnerable populations.

Time-Sensitive Advocacy Needs: This information is critical for advocacy efforts that inform stakeholders, ensure consumer protection, and foster transparency. Any delay could impede the ability of stakeholders, including advocacy groups and affected individuals, to respond adequately to Medicaid policy changes.

Justification for Fee Waiver
This information will serve the public interest by supporting oversight, transparency, and protection for Medicaid recipients, particularly Connecticut’s ABI Waiver participants. The release of these records will contribute to the ethical and accountable administration of taxpayer-funded programs. Accordingly, I request a waiver of fees for processing this request.

Delivery and Accessibility Requirements
To accommodate disability-related needs, please provide all records in digital format via email and avoid using external portals. If records cannot be provided within statutory timeframes, or if any information is withheld, please notify me promptly with legal justifications at AabiWR@live.com

Thank you for your attention and assistance in providing these records to facilitate public understanding and oversight of Connecticut Medicaid services.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
ABI Resources

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS

communications.communication:
Subject: Appeal of FOIA Response and Request for Full Officer Identification in Compliance with Basic Accommodation

Dear FOIA Officer/Supervisory Officer,

I am writing to formally appeal the recent response stating that “no responsive records” were found in relation to my FOIA request. My appeal is based on the expectation that all possible sources of relevant records are thoroughly reviewed to ensure a complete and adequate response in accordance with federal FOIA standards.

Additionally, within my original request, I specified a basic accommodation requesting the inclusion of the full name and contact information of the officer handling my request. This accommodation is essential for me to communicate effectively and participate fully in the FOIA process due to my documented needs. Unfortunately, I have yet to receive this information as requested, which I again request to be provided in all responses going forward.

For clarity, I kindly request that you re-confirm that all avenues have been explored to locate responsive records. I also request that responses going forward contain the full language within the body of the email, rather than solely as attachments, as previously requested. These accommodations ensure that I can review and process information effectively given my specific accessibility needs.

Thank you for your attention to these essential accommodations and for your continued assistance in handling this request comprehensively.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
AabiWR@live.com

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2025-00455-FOIA-PHS
communications.communication:
Subject: Appeal and Request for Accessible Response in FOIA Communications

Dear FOIA Officer/Supervisory Officer

I am writing to address the recent notification concerning my Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request dated October 30, 2024, which was received on October 31, 2024, and subsequently transferred to the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS).

First, I respectfully appeal the closure of my FOIA request within your office prior to ensuring a full and adequate response to my inquiry. This is essential as my inquiry pertains to specific information that, under the decentralized FOIA administration, requires continuity and thorough communication. Given my position and involvement as a documented whistleblower, this transfer to CMS for a separate logging and tracking process should include assurance of continuity, protection from delays, and accessibility in response.

Further, I am requesting a basic accommodation that the full language of future responses be included within the body of emails rather than solely as attachments. Due to my documented TBI and associated difficulties, having the response directly in the email body is crucial for my full and effective participation in the FOIA process.

Please confirm the transfer details of my request to CMS, including contact points and the assigned tracking number. Additionally, I request CMS acknowledge receipt of my request and fulfill the accommodation of including the full response language within the body of future email communications.

Thank you for your attention to these matters and for your assistance in facilitating accessible and effective communication in accordance with my rights.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
AabiWR@live.com

Federal Agencies: Records from any forums, workshops, or review meetings with DSS regarding Connecticut’s Medicaid amendments, ABI Waiver program updates, or evaluations of managed care models.

Analysis, Recommendations, and Raw Data

Connecticut DSS and Federal Agencies (CMS, GAO): All data, draft versions, and final recommendations produced by Accenture and Manatt, including raw data, methodology documentation, and preliminary findings related to Medicaid program evaluations.
CDC Data on ABI/TBI: Any ABI or TBI-related data provided to DSS, Accenture, or Manatt, which may impact Medicaid ABI Waiver amendments.

Medicaid Provider and Consumer Access and Contact Records
Connecticut DSS: Documentation on Medicaid provider registry updates, provider affiliations, approval dates, and criteria used to select providers for feedback or analysis.
Federal Oversight: GAO or OIG records on Medicaid provider networks and consumer engagement requirements, particularly in relation to accessibility for individuals with disabilities.

Accessibility and Data Collection Accommodations
Connecticut DSS and Federal Agencies: Documentation of accommodations ensuring accessibility for individuals with disabilities, including language assistance, assistive technology, and accommodations in data collection and stakeholder engagement processes.
FOIA Compliance and Whistleblower Reports

Connecticut DSS and Federal Oversight (OIG, DOJ Civil Rights): Records related to previous FOIA requests, exemptions, information withheld, and any legal citations applied, as well as whistleblower complaints or investigations into DSS, Accenture, or Manatt regarding Medicaid program oversight, ethical conduct, or data manipulation.


Expedited processing is requested based on the following compelling factors:

Significant Public Interest in Government Transparency: Medicaid programs are taxpayer-funded and affect a large segment of the public. Ensuring that DSS’s activities and collaborations with consulting firms like Accenture and Manatt align with federal and state standards is of great public interest. Expedited processing will allow public scrutiny and foster informed dialogue on the management and ethical administration of Medicaid services. The requested information will help assess whether any waste, fraud, or abuse has occurred within DSS’s partnerships. Prompt access to these records is essential to identify any potential misconduct and prevent ongoing misuse of taxpayer dollars, particularly within critical programs affecting vulnerable populations.

Time-Sensitive Advocacy Needs: This information is critical for advocacy efforts that inform stakeholders, ensure consumer protection, and foster transparency. Any delay could impede the ability of stakeholders, including advocacy groups and affected individuals, to respond adequately to Medicaid policy changes.

Justification for Fee Waiver
This information will serve the public interest by supporting oversight, transparency, and protection for Medicaid recipients, particularly Connecticut’s ABI Waiver participants. The release of these records will contribute to the ethical and accountable administration of taxpayer-funded programs. Accordingly, I request a waiver of fees for processing this request.

Delivery and Accessibility Requirements
To accommodate disability-related needs, please provide all records in digital format via email and avoid using external portals. If records cannot be provided within statutory timeframes, or if any information is withheld, please notify me promptly with legal justifications at AabiWR@live.com

Thank you for your attention and assistance in providing these records to facilitate public understanding and oversight of Connecticut Medicaid services.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
ABI Resources

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS

Documentation from federal agencies related to funding compliance, regulatory oversight, or audits, evaluations, or investigations assessing DSS’s Medicaid program management, especially regarding the ABI Waiver and the involvement of Accenture and Manatt.

Detailed Records Requested
Please provide copies of the following documents:

Contracts, Agreements, and Operational Frameworks
Connecticut DSS: Contracts, MOUs, agreements, and scope of work documents between DSS and Accenture or Manatt.
Federal Agencies (CMS, HHS, GAO, OIG): Federal approvals, reviews, or conditions placed on Connecticut’s Medicaid amendments or funding, particularly involving the ABI Waiver and managed care services.

Communications and Procedural Directives
Connecticut DSS: Email and written communications between DSS officials and representatives of Accenture and Manatt, specifically concerning Medicaid program amendments, stakeholder engagement, and managed care exploration.
Federal Agencies: Correspondence with DSS or contractors, as well as procedural directives involving Accenture or Manatt’s contributions to Medicaid policy or program operations.
Metadata and Communication Logs: Metadata (sender, recipient, date, subject) and communication logs documenting DSS, CMS, HHS, or GAO interactions with Accenture or Manatt.

Meetings and Strategy Documentation
Connecticut DSS: Agendas, minutes, attendance records, and presentations from strategic planning sessions involving DSS, Accenture, and Manatt.
Federal Agencies: Records from any forums, workshops, or review meetings with DSS regarding Connecticut’s Medicaid amendments, ABI Waiver program updates, or evaluations of managed care models.

Analysis, Recommendations, and Raw Data

Connecticut DSS and Federal Agencies (CMS, GAO): All data, draft versions, and final recommendations produced by Accenture and Manatt, including raw data, methodology documentation, and preliminary findings related to Medicaid program evaluations.
CDC Data on ABI/TBI: Any ABI or TBI-related data provided to DSS, Accenture, or Manatt, which may impact Medicaid ABI Waiver amendments.

Medicaid Provider and Consumer Access and Contact Records
Connecticut DSS: Documentation on Medicaid provider registry updates, provider affiliations, approval dates, and criteria used to select providers for feedback or analysis.
Federal Oversight: GAO or OIG records on Medicaid provider networks and consumer engagement requirements, particularly in relation to accessibility for individuals with disabilities.

Accessibility and Data Collection Accommodations
Connecticut DSS and Federal Agencies: Documentation of accommodations ensuring accessibility for individuals with disabilities, including language assistance, assistive technology, and accommodations in data collection and stakeholder engagement processes.
FOIA Compliance and Whistleblower Reports

Connecticut DSS and Federal Oversight (OIG, DOJ Civil Rights): Records related to previous FOIA requests, exemptions, information withheld, and any legal citations applied, as well as whistleblower complaints or investigations into DSS, Accenture, or Manatt regarding Medicaid program oversight, ethical conduct, or data manipulation.


Expedited processing is requested based on the following compelling factors:

Significant Public Interest in Government Transparency: Medicaid programs are taxpayer-funded and affect a large segment of the public. Ensuring that DSS’s activities and collaborations with consulting firms like Accenture and Manatt align with federal and state standards is of great public interest. Expedited processing will allow public scrutiny and foster informed dialogue on the management and ethical administration of Medicaid services. The requested information will help assess whether any waste, fraud, or abuse has occurred within DSS’s partnerships. Prompt access to these records is essential to identify any potential misconduct and prevent ongoing misuse of taxpayer dollars, particularly within critical programs affecting vulnerable populations.

Time-Sensitive Advocacy Needs: This information is critical for advocacy efforts that inform stakeholders, ensure consumer protection, and foster transparency. Any delay could impede the ability of stakeholders, including advocacy groups and affected individuals, to respond adequately to Medicaid policy changes.

Justification for Fee Waiver
This information will serve the public interest by supporting oversight, transparency, and protection for Medicaid recipients, particularly Connecticut’s ABI Waiver participants. The release of these records will contribute to the ethical and accountable administration of taxpayer-funded programs. Accordingly, I request a waiver of fees for processing this request.

Delivery and Accessibility Requirements
To accommodate disability-related needs, please provide all records in digital format via email and avoid using external portals. If records cannot be provided within statutory timeframes, or if any information is withheld, please notify me promptly with legal justifications at AabiWR@live.com

Thank you for your attention and assistance in providing these records to facilitate public understanding and oversight of Connecticut Medicaid services.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
ABI Resources

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS
